intro: Lepicephalus dagestanicus, commonly known as the Dagestan lepicephalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous areas with cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
